page.title: 16RAILWAY MANIA.
page.content: A resident of Whitley Head,which is two rows of houses about half a mile out of Steeton,is so enthusiastic about railways that he has a railway engine in his back garden. The engine is a Deltaic Diesel, which is approximately 22 years old.It was used for pulling the main express engines in Britain,including the Flying Scotsman.It was one of the most powerful engines ever built.This engine and twenty-one other similar diesel engines were built to replace fifty-four steam engines and this shows how powerful they were.The engine originated from Doncaster where it was built in 1963.
